item.title: [PI] || Sunita Loading Bar Release || [PI]
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

i was thinking of doing this for my loading
except it would have the login in black and white and turn colorful as it progresses

but it looks like you did this waaaay wrong
looks like you draw the full bar, then draw the black image over it as it progresses it becomes more revealed
proper way wuld be like this

empty.drawSprite(50, 400); full.drawSprite(50, 400, %);
look at how the hp bar is done

item.title: [PI] || Sunita Loading Bar Release || [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Bullos Bullos
item.description:
@Bullos wrote:

im releasing my loading bar

Preview of what you are adding
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DU_ZMX-I2Wg[/youtube]

here is my drawloadingtext method

public void drawLoadingText(int l, String c) { anInt1079 = l; aString1049 = c; resetImageProducers(); if (titleStreamLoader == null) { super.drawLoadingText(l, c); return; } aRSImageProducer_1109.initDrawingArea(); loadingBarFull = new Sprite("Login/Full"); loadingBarEmpty = new Sprite("Login/Empty"); loadingBarFull.drawSprite(0, 400); loadingBarEmpty.drawSprite(-7 + Math.round((l * 784) / 200), 400); if (l == 194) { aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, c + " - 100%", 410, 378); } else { aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, c + " - " + (l / 2) + "%", 410, 378); } aRSImageProducer_1109.drawGraphics(0, super.graphics, 0); if (welcomeScreenRaised) { welcomeScreenRaised = false; } }

the Loading Sprites

http://uppit.com/vxfe440p568x/Login.rar

if you want me to make some nice sprites Totaly Free! for your loading bar
feel free to contact me

skype : dezixleader

credits

100% me

Read full topic
